summary: This document is an email chain from August 28, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing logistical arrangements for a trip to Palm Beach, Florida. The trip's purpose is to conduct a proffer session with an unnamed individual and potentially meet with victims as part of the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators. The emails focus on hotel conference room booking and billing procedures.

events.title: Meeting with victims
events.description: A meeting was held with victims of Jeffrey Epstein, which was described as very helpful to the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Planned travel to Palm Beach for proffer
events.description: SDNY prosecutors plan to travel to Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct a proffer session with an unnamed individual regarding the investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators. They also plan to potentially meet with additional victims.

keyFacts: The email confirms an ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators as of August 2019.
SDNY prosecutors met with victims on or around August 27, 2019, and found it very helpful.
Prosecutors planned to travel to Palm Beach the following week for a proffer session with an individual connected to the investigation.
The emails detail strict internal procedures for billing hotel conference rooms, indicating heightened scrutiny or audit standards.
All specific names of prosecutors and staff involved in the email chain are redacted.
